poem:
Title: In Celebration of a Borough's Blossom

Two roads emerged in Croydon's midst,
Were met by silver screen's first kiss.
A gleam within the morning fog,
Its city streets, its faithful cog. 
From weary past, new stories sprung,
Oscars' applause in mother tongue.
Hers, a tale the world must know,
From Peep Show roots, to vibrant glow.
Peering through the facelift's strife,
In Croydon's waking - a new life.
